subject: Politics
title: Authoritarianism's Comeback
description: A fast breakdown of Authoritarianism's Comeback for builders.

hook.text: In 2000, democracy seemed inevitable. By 2024, authoritarianism gains ground. History doesn't move in one direction.

buildup.text: China's growth, Russia's defiance, and democratic dysfunction have made authoritarianism look viable again.

discovery.text: Authoritarian regimes study each other. They share surveillance tech, propaganda tactics, and repression methods.

twist.text: Some citizens prefer authoritarian stability over democratic chaos. Order beats freedom when life feels insecure.

climax.text: The battle between democracy and authoritarianism will define global politics for the next generation.

punchline.text: Democracy is not inevitable. It must be defended or it will be lost.

quiz.question: How do modern authoritarian regimes support each other?
options: They share surveillance technology, propaganda tactics, and repression methods
They hold free elections to legitimize each other
They never communicate or cooperate with other regimes
